action.content:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

declaration

Related words are:

- law
- resolution
- testimony

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, the target word is "declaration," and I need to describe it without using the word itself or the related words: law, resolution, testimony. Let me think about what a declaration is. It's a formal statement, right? Like when someone makes an official announcement. Maybe words like "statement," "announcement," or "proclamation" could work. But I have to make sure not to use any of the related words. Let me check the synonyms. "Declaration" can also be called a "pronouncement" or "announcement." Wait, "resolution" is a related word, so I can't use that. Maybe "formal statement" is safe. Or "public announcement." Let me make sure none of the related words are in there. "Law" isn't there. "Testimony" is about giving evidence, which is different. So maybe "A formal statement made publicly" or "An official announcement." That should work. Let me pick the shortest one. "Formal statement" is concise. But maybe "public announcement" is better. Wait, the user said to be to the point. Let me go with "A formal statement made publicly." But maybe even shorter: "Formal public statement." Yeah, that's short and to the point. Doesn't use any forbidden words. Okay, that should be the clue.
</think>

CLUE: Formal public statement
action.label: response
